description:
Join us for a natter and a chance to find your next good read. The evening provides an opportunity to shout about a professional book that you rate and hear what other people recommend. Along the way there's time for a natter, a wee dram and a mince pie, you may even get some last minute present ideas.

Conscious that we’re all spending time online looking at screens we’ll start early, and try to find a format that works audio only, so you can join from the fireside in your fluffy slippers.

Festivities aside there is a serious point to this – our time and attention are precious, new books and publications constantly appear with varying degrees of quality and novelty. It is hard to judge a book by the cover, or indeed buzz word filled marketing blurb, so we’ll be using the wisdom of the community to find out where to invest our time.

It works like this:
Anyone who wants to recommend a read brings a book along, we move into small groups and hear about the books people have brought, allowing time for questions and discussion.

Book recommenders should:
-Introduce the book’s main theme and topic
-Describe why it was valuable to them
-Explain who they would recommend it to and why.

We aren’t looking for a detailed description of the book content, the whole idea is to inspire people’s next read.

We’ll also see if we can collect some data, and get recommendations for categories, such as ‘Best book for aspiring team leads’ or ‘Best DevOps book for managers’

As always we welcome input and ideas, especially for the categories above, do share your thoughts and help shape the evening.*

Remote meeting details will be sent closer to the event.

*Offer excludes Mariah Carey Christmas Karaoke
title: Reindeer and Reading – A thinly Veiled Excuse For a Christmas get together.
